news_items.headline: Samsung to unveil square-shaped foldable phones to challenge Apple
news_items.lede: Samsung Electronics is set to unveil a new, square-shaped foldable smartphone and updated versions of its flagship Galaxy S range on Tuesday, seeking to revive sales after ceding its smartphone crown to Apple Inc last quarter.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Samsung Electronics is seen at its office building in Seoul, South Korea, Jan. 7, 2019. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. appeals court denies Apple bid for rehearing in VirnetX patent case
news_items.lede: A U.S. appeals court on Monday denied a request by Apple Inc <AAPL.O> that it reconsider a decision upholding a finding Apple iPhones infringed VirnetX Holding Corp patents relating to secure communications technology.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple Inc. logo is seen hanging at the entrance to the Apple store on 5th Avenue in Manhattan, New York, U.S., October 16, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. appeals court denies Apple bid for rehearing in VirnetX patent case
news_items.lede: A U.S. appeals court on Monday denied a request by Apple Inc that it reconsider a November 2019 decision that upheld a finding that Apple iPhones infringed two VirnetX Holding Corp patents relating to secure communications technology. (Reporting by Jan Wolfe)

news_items.headline: Apple's main iPhone maker Foxconn to resume some Chinese production: source
news_items.lede: Apple's main iPhone maker Foxconn <2317.TW> got the green light on Monday to reopen two major plants in China closed because of the coronavirus and aims to resume production even though only 10% of the workforce has returned so far, a source told Reuters.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: CEO Tim Cook presents the new iPhone 11 at an Apple event at their headquarters in Cupertino, California, U.S. September 10, 2019. REUTERS/Stephen Lam/File Photo

news_items.headline: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn approved to resume Shenzhen plant production: source
news_items.lede: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn <2317.TW> has received Chinese government approval to resume production at a key plant in the southern city of Shenzhen, a source with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters late on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People wearing protective masks are seen in an Apple Store, as China is hit by an outbreak of the new coronavirus, in Shanghai, China, January 29, 2020.  REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn approved to resume Shenzhen plant production -source
news_items.lede: Apple iPhone maker Foxconn has received Chinese government approval to resume production at a key plant in the southern city of Shenzhen, a source with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters late on Monday.

news_items.headline: China's Shenzhen denies blocking Apple supplier Foxconn from resuming production
news_items.lede: Local Chinese authorities have not blocked Apple <AAPL.O> supplier Foxconn <2317.TW> from resuming production amid a coronavirus outbreak, they said in a statement on Sunday, denying an earlier report in the Nikkei Business Daily.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Foxconn, the trading name of Hon Hai Precision Industry, is seen on top of the company's building in Taipei, Taiwan March 30, 2018. REUTERS/Tyrone Siu/File Photo

news_items.headline: Apple to delay reopening of retail stores in China
news_items.lede: Apple Inc is extending its retail store closures in China due to the coronavirus outbreak, even as it worked toward opening its corporate offices and contact centers, the iPhone maker said on Friday.
news_items.img_cap: A man wearing a face mask walks past a closed Apple store at Sanlitun, as the country is hit by an outbreak of the new coronavirus, in Beijing, China February 7, 2020. REUTERS/Jason Lee

news_items.headline: BRIEF-Apple Says Working Toward Re-Opening Corporate Offices And Contact Centers In China In The Week Of February 10
news_items.lede: * APPLE SAYS WORKING TOWARD RE-OPENING CORPORATE OFFICES AND CONTACT CENTERS IN CHINA IN THE WEEK OF FEBRUARY 10

news_items.headline: BRIEF-French consumer regulatory body fines Apple €25 mln
news_items.lede: * HAS BEEN FINED 25 MILLION EUROS BY FRENCH CONSUMER REGULATORY BODY DGCCRF Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage: (Paris Newsroom)

news_items.headline: Free trials boost Spotify subscribers at cost of revenue
news_items.lede: Spotify Technology SA on Wednesday forecast current-quarter revenue largely below analysts' estimates, as the streaming service spends more on promotions to lure listeners in its battle against Apple Music and Amazon.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A smartphone is seen in front of a screen projection of Spotify logo, in this picture illustration taken April 1, 2018. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Exclusive: iPhone app makers questioned in U.S. antitrust probe of Apple - sources
news_items.lede: The U.S. Justice Department has reached out to app developers as part of its investigation into Apple Inc <AAPL.O>, one of the four big tech companies being probed for alleged anti-competitive behavior, according one of the developers and another person familiar with the...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People look at an app on the new iPhone inside the new Apple Store, before its official opening on September 28, during a media tour in Mexico City, Mexico September 25, 2019. REUTERS/Carlos Jasso/File Photo

news_items.headline: Goldman in talks with Amazon to offer small business loans: FT
news_items.lede: Goldman Sachs Group Inc <GS.N> is in advanced talks with Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O> to offer small- and medium-sized businesses loans in the United States on the e-commerce giant's lending platform, the Financial Times reported on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A view of the Goldman Sachs stall on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange July 16, 2013. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo

news_items.headline: Apple supplier Wistron to assemble key iPhone component in new India plant: sources
news_items.lede: Taiwan's Wistron Corp plans to assemble printed circuit boards (PCBs) for iPhones at its new plant in southern India, two sources said, highlighting Apple Inc's push to expand manufacturing in the world's second-biggest smartphone market.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A salesman uses his iPhone at a mobile phone store in New Delhi, India, July 27, 2016. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi/File Photo

news_items.headline: Apple to close all China mainland stores due to virus outbreak
news_items.lede: Apple Inc on Saturday said it would shut all of its official stores and corporate offices in mainland China until Feb 9. as fears over the coronavirus outbreak mounted and the death toll more than doubled to over 250 from a week ago.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People wearing protective masks are seen in an Apple Store, as China is hit by an outbreak of the new coronavirus, in Shanghai, China, January 29, 2020. REUTERS/Aly Song

news_items.headline: Apple to shut down all official stores in Chinese mainland due to virus outbreak
news_items.lede: Apple Inc on Saturday said it has decided to shut down all of its official stores in mainland China until Feb 9., as fears over the coronavirus outbreak mounted and the death toll more than doubled to over 250 from a week ago.

news_items.headline: Apple supplier Japan Display gets $920 million bailout from Ichigo
news_items.lede: Japan Display Inc <6740.T> said on Friday it had sealed a deal to receive up to 100.8 billion yen ($918.87 million) from Ichigo Asset Management, a critical bailout for the Apple supplier that has been dependant on publicly funded rescues.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Japan Display's logo is seen at a display of its products at its headquarters in Tokyo, Japan October 7, 2019. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon

news_items.headline: LG Display looks to a more positive 2020 on OLED demand, shares rise
news_items.lede: Apple supplier LG Display Co Ltd posted a smaller-than-expected quarterly loss on Friday and offered an optimistic outlook for the year on higher demand for its organic light-emitting diode (OLED) panels, sending its shares up 4%.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A man walks out of the headquarters of LG Display in Seoul, October 20, 2011.  REUTERS/Jo Yong-Hak/File Photo

news_items.headline: SK Hynix Q4 profit tumbles 95%, hit by prolonged chip downturn
news_items.lede: South Korea's SK Hynix , a chip supplier to Apple Inc and Huawei , said on Friday its fourth-quarter operating profit slumped 95%, missing analysts' estimates, as chip prices were hit by oversupply and a demand slowdown.

news_items.headline: Apple supplier LG Display posts fourth quarterly loss in a row
news_items.lede: Apple supplier LG Display Co Ltd reported its fourth quarterly operating loss in a row on Friday, hit by lower liquid crystal display (LCD) panel prices and restructuring costs.

news_items.headline: Apple redesigns mapping app for U.S. users
news_items.lede: Apple Inc said on Thursday it has rolled out a redesigned version of its Maps for users in the United States, offering features including indoor maps of airports and malls.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple logo is shown atop an Apple store at a shopping mall in La Jolla, California, U.S., December 17, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: EU lawmakers, with eye on Apple, call for common mobile charger
news_items.lede: EU lawmakers overwhelmingly called on Thursday for rules to establish a common charger for all mobile device makers across Europe, a drive that iPhone maker Apple has criticised.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Silhouette of mobile user is seen next to a screen projection of Apple logo in this picture illustration taken March 28, 2018.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: CalTech wins $1.1 billion jury verdict in patent case against Apple, Broadcom
news_items.lede: The California Institute of Technology said on Wednesday that it won a $1.1 billion jury verdict in a patent case against Apple <AAPL.O> and Broadcom <AVGO.O>.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A 3D printed Apple logo is seen in front of a displayed stock graph in this illustration taken February 26, 2016. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P 500 fades to end lower after Fed policy announcement
news_items.lede: The S&P 500 ended slightly lower on Wednesday, as an initial boost from the likes of Apple Inc, Boeing Co and General Electric Co following their quarterly results faded in the wake of the policy announcement from the Federal Reserve.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Apple, Boeing lift Wall Street as Fed stands pat
news_items.lede: * Dow up 0.57%, S&P 500 up 0.45%, Nasdaq up 0.54% (Updates with Fed statement; changes byline)

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Apple, Boeing lift Wall Street ahead of Fed decision
news_items.lede: * Indexes up: Dow 0.38%, S&P 0.29%, Nasdaq 0.34% (Updates to early afternoon)

news_items.headline: Apple's iPhone strength is back and analysts say it is here to stay
news_items.lede: Wall Street analysts were smitten by a rebound in sales of Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> iPhones after a year of decline and said strong demand for new models, spurred by trade-in programs and heavy discounts on older models, will drive growth this year.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A man walks next to an advertisement for Apple's new iPhone 11 Pro at the Apple Store in IFC, Central district, Hong Kong, China October 10, 2019, after Apple Inc on Wednesday removed an app that protestors in Hong Kong have used to track police movements from its app store. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Wall St edges higher on Apple, Boeing strength; Fed in focus
news_items.lede: * Starbucks slips as coronavirus prompts store closures in China

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Apple, Boeing bolster Wall Street at open
news_items.lede: Wall Street opened higher on Wednesday as a surge in shares of Apple, Boeing and General Electric after their results overshadowed concerns over the economic impact of a fast-spreading coronavirus.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Futures gain as Apple earnings take some focus off virus concerns
news_items.lede: U.S. stock index futures rose on Wednesday as strong results from Apple and other marquee companies kicked fourth-quarter earnings into top gear and overshadowed concerns over the economic impact of the fast-spreading coronavirus.

news_items.headline: Foxconn says plans in place to meet production obligations after virus outbreak
news_items.lede: TAIPEI - Apple Inc supplier Foxconn said it could continue to meet all manufacturing obligations in the wake of a coronavirus outbreak in China even as the iPhone maker flagged uncertainty created by the disease.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Foxconn, the trading name of Hon Hai Precision Industry, is seen on top of the company's building in Taipei, Taiwan March 30, 2018. REUTERS/Tyrone Siu

news_items.headline: GLOBAL MARKETS-Asian stocks rise as Apple drives tech gains, virus worries ease
news_items.lede: Asian shares rose on Wednesday as better-than-expected Apple Inc earnings drove some regional tech gains although broader confidence was capped by worries about the economic impact of China's virus outbreak.

news_items.headline: Apple's iPhone back to growth as company braces for coronavirus impact
news_items.lede: The iPhone is back. But Apple is girding for more disruptions in virus-hit China.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A 3D printed Apple logo is seen in front of a displayed stock graph in this illustration taken February 26, 2016. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: Apple sparks Wall Street bounce ahead of results
news_items.lede: U.S. stocks rebounded on Tuesday, as the S&P 500 bounced back from its worst day in nearly four months, led by a climb in Apple and other names hit by exposure concerns to the coronavirus outbreak in China that sparked a recent sell-off.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange shortly after the opening bell in New York, U.S., January 24, 2020.  REUTERS/Lucas Jackson/File Photo

news_items.headline: Apple iPhone sales return to growth, pushing profits above expectations
news_items.lede: Apple Inc on Tuesday reported sales and profits for the holiday shopping quarter above Wall Street expectations, powered by a rise in iPhone sales for the first time in a year and soaring demand for add-ons like AirPods wireless headphones.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall Street rebounds from China virus fears, Apple soars
news_items.lede: U.S. stocks rebounded on Tuesday, with the S&P 500 recovering from its biggest one-day percentage drop in nearly four months, led by a climb in shares of Apple Inc and other names hit by concerns of exposure to the coronavirus outbreak in China that sparked a recent sell-off...

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Apple leads Wall St rebound ahead of results
news_items.lede: * Dow up 0.96%, S&P 500 up 1.26%, Nasdaq up 1.58% (Updates to mid-afternoon, changes byline)

news_items.headline: Huawei snatched market share from Apple, local rivals in China in 2019
news_items.lede: Top Chinese smartphone maker Huawei Technologies Co Ltd thrived in 2019 at the expense of smaller Chinese rivals and Apple <AAPL.O> even as the smartphone market shrank further and consumers favored phones with 5G technology, data shows.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A Huawei company logo at Shenzhen International Airport in Shenzhen, Guangdong province, China, July 22, 2019. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

news_items.headline: Services in spotlight after Apple stock market value hits $1.4 trillion
news_items.lede: When Apple Inc <AAPL.O> posts quarterly results on Tuesday, investors will be looking for fresh evidence the iPhone maker should be treated as a producer of high-margin, subscription services after its stock market value touched $1.4 trillion and its earnings multiple trades...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple Inc. logo is seen hanging at the entrance to the Apple store on 5th Avenue in Manhattan, New York, U.S., October 16, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

news_items.headline: Coronavirus outbreak may disrupt Apple's iPhone production ramp up plans: Nikkei
news_items.lede: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> plan to ramp up iPhone production by 10% in the first half of this year may hit a roadblock as the coronavirus outbreak spreads across China, the Nikkei Asian Review reported on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Apple's new (L-R) iPhone 11 Pro Max, 11 Pro and 11 are displayed after they went on sale at the Apple Store in Beijing, China , September 20, 2019. REUTERS/Jason Lee

news_items.headline: IN BRIEF: Jury tells Apple to pay $85 million in WiLAN patent retrial
news_items.lede: A U.S. jury on Friday said Apple Inc should pay $85 million for infringing patents owned by technology licensing firm WiLAN Inc.

news_items.headline: Broadcom to supply wireless components to Apple
news_items.lede: Chipmaker Broadcom Inc <AVGO.O> said on Thursday it has entered into two multi-year agreements with Apple Inc <AAPL.O> for the supply of wireless components used in its products.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A sign to the campus offices of chip maker Broadcom Ltd is shown in Irvine, California, U.S., November 6, 2017. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google finds security flaws in Apple's web browser: FT
news_items.lede: Google researchers have found multiple security flaws in Apple Inc's Safari web browser that allowed the tracking of users' browsing behavior, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing a soon-to-be published paper.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple logo is shown atop an Apple store at a shopping mall in La Jolla, California, U.S., December 17, 2019, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Google finds security flaws in Apple's web browser - FT
news_items.lede: Google researchers have found multiple security flaws in Apple Inc's Safari web browser that allowed the tracking of users' browsing behavior, Financial Times reported https://www.ft.com/content/916a766a-3d27-11ea-a01a-bae547046735 on Wednesday, citing a soon-to-be published...

news_items.headline: Amazon Music crosses 55 million subscribers globally, trails Apple Music
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc said on Wednesday its music streaming service had over 55 million customers globally, edging close to Apple Music but far behind Swedish rival Spotify.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, August 8, 2018. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol/File Photo

news_items.headline: Trump to break bread with Apple's Cook and other CEOs: sources
news_items.lede: U.S. President Donald Trump will attend a breakfast meeting on Wednesday with Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook and other business leaders on the sidelines of the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, according to sources familiar with the situation...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Apple CEO Tim Cook speaks with U.S. President Donald Trump as he tours Apple's Mac Pro manufacturing plant with White House senior adviser Ivanka Trump and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin in Austin, Texas, U.S., November 20, 2019. REUTERS/Tom Brenner/File Photo

news_items.headline: Taiwan calls on China to share 'correct' virus information
news_items.lede: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen called on China on Wednesday to share "correct" information about a new coronavirus and for the World Health Organisation (WHO) not to exclude Taiwan from collaboration on the outbreak for political reasons.
news_items.img_cap: Foxconn employees wearing masks attend the company's year-end gala in Taipei, Taiwan January 22, 2020. REUTERS/Yimou Lee

news_items.headline: Exclusive: Apple dropped plan for encrypting backups after FBI complained - sources
news_items.lede: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> dropped plans to let iPhone users fully encrypt backups of their devices in the company's iCloud service after the FBI complained that the move would harm investigations, six sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A woman uses her Apple iPhone and laptop in a cafe in lower Manhattan in New York City, U.S., May 8, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

news_items.headline: Apple lawsuit tests if an employee can plan rival startup while on payroll
news_items.lede: Attorneys for a former Apple Inc executive on Tuesday will try to convince a skeptical judge of a core tenet of tech startup culture - that employees can plan a competing venture while still in a job.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple Inc. logo is seen hanging at the entrance to the Apple store on 5th Avenue in Manhattan, New York, U.S., October 16, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

news_items.headline: DAVOS-Trump to break bread with Apple's Cook and other CEOs -sources
news_items.lede: U.S. President Donald Trump will attend a breakfast meeting on Wednesday with Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook and other business leaders on the sidelines of the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, according to sources familiar with the situation...

news_items.headline: DAVOS-Trump attending dinner with Apple's cook and other CEOs - source
news_items.lede: U.S. President Donald Trump is attending a dinner on Tuesday with Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook and other CEOs on the sidelines of the annual meeting of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, according to a source familiar with the situation.

news_items.headline: Apple's Cook says global corporate tax system must be overhauled
news_items.lede: Everyone knows that the global corporate tax system needs to be overhauled, Apple <AAPL.O> Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Monday, backing changes to global rules that are currently under consideration.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Apple's CEO Tim Cook speaks with Singapore Paralympian Theresa Goh (unseen) at the OCBC Aquatic Centre, Singapore Sports Hub December 12, 2019. REUTERS/Edgar Su

news_items.headline: Apple's Cook says global corporate tax system must be overhauled
news_items.lede: Everyone knows that the global corporate tax system needs to be overhauled, Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Monday, backing changes to global rules that are currently under consideration.

news_items.headline: Apple's 'Morning Show' will deal with 'chaos' left behind in new season
news_items.lede: The second season of Apple Inc's "The Morning Show" will deal with the leadership vacuum created by the sexual misconduct scandal on the fictional news program and may or may not see the return of star Steve Carell, producers said on Sunday.
news_items.img_cap: Reese Witherspoon (R) and Jennifer Aniston arrive to the global premiere for Apple's "The Morning Show" at the Lincoln Center in the Manhattan borough of New York City, U.S., October 28, 2019. Picture taken October 28, 2019. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz

news_items.headline: Break up big tech's 'monopoly', smaller rivals tell Congress hearing
news_items.lede: In April 2019, Tile.com, which helps users find lost or misplaced items, suddenly found itself competing with Apple Inc, after years of enjoying a mutually beneficial relationship with the iPhone maker.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple Inc. logo is seen hanging at the entrance to the Apple store on 5th Avenue in Manhattan, New York, U.S., October 16, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar

news_items.headline: Mnuchin urges Apple, other tech companies to work with law enforcement
news_items.lede: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and other technology companies should cooperate with U.S. investigators, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday as law enforcement officials continued probing last month's fatal shooting at a U.S. naval base in Florida.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple Inc. logo is seen hanging at the entrance to the Apple store on 5th Avenue in Manhattan, New York, U.S., October 16, 2019. REUTERS/Mike Segar

news_items.headline: Trump criticizes Apple's encryption stance on Pensacola phones
news_items.lede: President Donald Trump lashed out at Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on Tuesday, castigating the iPhone maker for what he said was its refusal to unlock phones used by criminals while benefiting from government help on trade.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple logo is shown atop an Apple store at a shopping mall in La Jolla, California, U.S., December 17, 2019, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: VW CEO says carmaker faces same fate as Nokia without urgent reforms
news_items.lede: Volkswagen Chief Executive Herbert Diess said the German carmaker needs to accelerate its transformation to avoid becoming another Nokia , which lost its dominance in the handset market to Apple.

news_items.headline: U.S.'s Mnuchin urges Apple, other tech cos to work with law enforcement
news_items.lede: Apple Inc and other technology companies must cooperate with U.S. investigators, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday, a day after President Donald Trump lashed out at Apple for refusing to unlock phones in criminal investigations.

news_items.headline: Trump says Apple refusing to unlock phones used by 'killers, drug dealers'
news_items.lede: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that Apple Inc has refused to unlock phones used by criminals, in a tweet a day after Trump's attorney general accused the company of not being helpful in an investigation of a Florida shooting.

news_items.headline: Apple rejects claims it did not provide assistance in Pensacola shooting probe
news_items.lede: Apple Inc on Monday said it rejects "the characterization that Apple has not provided substantive assistance" in the investigation into a shooting in Pensacola, Florida, last month.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An Apple logo is seen at an Apple store as pre-Thanksgiving and Christmas holiday shopping accelerates at the King of Prussia Mall in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, U.S. November 22, 2019. REUTERS/Mark Makela

news_items.headline: Apple pushes recycling of iPhone with 'Daisy' robot
news_items.lede: (This corrects temperature conversion in seventh paragraph in the story dated January 10.)
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Aluminum iPhone cases after they've completed the deconstruction process by Daisy, an iPhone recycling robot, are seen at an Apple recycling facility in Austin, Texas, U.S., August 21, 2019. REUTERS/Spencer Selvidge

news_items.headline: Apple pushes recycling with robot, but mined metals still needed
news_items.lede: Apple Inc is trying to change the way electronics are recycled with a robot that disassembles its iconic iPhone so that minerals can be recovered and reused, but rising global demand for electronics means new mines will still be needed by manufacturers.

news_items.headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall Street notches records on trade optimism, Apple gains
news_items.lede: U.S. stocks registered record high closes on Thursday as optimism about a U.S.-China trade deal firmed and as Apple and other market heavyweights posted strong gains.

news_items.headline: Apple's iPhone sales in China up 18% in December: government data
news_items.lede: Sales of Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> iPhone in China in December jumped more than 18% year on year, government data showed on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: People walk past an Apple store in Beijing, China January 7, 2019. REUTERS/Thomas Peter

news_items.headline: Apple News users reach 100 million, App Store sales rise
news_items.lede: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> news service has reached 100 million monthly active users and customers spent more than $1.4 billion in the App Store between Christmas and New Year, the latest signs of growing revenue from the iPhone maker's services business.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple logo is shown atop an Apple store at a shopping mall in La Jolla, California, U.S., December 17, 2019, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Apple's news service reaches 100 million users, App Store sales expand
news_items.lede: Apple Inc on Wednesday said its Apple News service has reached 100 million monthly active users versus 85 million a year prior, demonstrating growth in a key services business that is being closely watched by investors as iPhone sales decline.

news_items.headline: Japan Display in talks to sell key smartphone screen plant to Apple, Sharp: Nikkei
news_items.lede: Cash-strapped Japan Display Inc <6740.T> is discussing the sale of its main smartphone screen factory to Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Sharp Corp <6753.T> for as much as $820 million, the Nikkei business daily reported on Friday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Japan Display's logo is seen at a display of its products at its headquarters in Tokyo, Japan October 7, 2019. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Japan Display discussing factory sale to Apple, Sharp -Nikkei
news_items.lede: * Japan Display still owes Apple more than $800 mln for the plant

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-Japan Display discussing factory sale to Apple, Sharp -Nikkei
news_items.lede: Japan Display Inc is discussing the sale of its key smartphone screen factory to Apple Inc and Sharp Corp for 80 billion to 90 billion yen ($730 million-$820 million), the Nikkei business daily reported on Friday.

news_items.headline: Apple held talks to add James Bond, live sports to streaming service: WSJ
news_items.lede: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> executives met James Bond franchise-owner MGM Holdings Inc and the collegiate athletic conference Pac-12 earlier this year as part of its efforts to boost the Apple TV service, the Wall Street Journal reported https://on.wsj.com/2PEGhH7 on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Apple logo is shown atop an Apple store at a shopping mall in La Jolla, California, U.S., December 17, 2019, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Apple, Amazon, Google partner to make smart home devices more compatible
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc <AMZN.O>, Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google are partnering to lay the groundwork for better compatibility among their smart home products, the companies said on Wednesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Prompts on how to use Amazon's Alexa personal assistant are seen as a wifi-equipped Roomba begins cleaning a room in an Amazon ‘experience center’  in Vallejo, California, U.S., May 8, 2018. REUTERS/Elijah Nouvelage

news_items.headline: Apple, Amazon, Google partner to make smart home devices more compatible
news_items.lede: Amazon.com Inc, Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google are partnering to lay the groundwork for better compatibility among their smart home products, the companies said on Wednesday.

news_items.headline: Wall St Week Ahead-Trade deal removes major hurdle for rally in Apple and tech
news_items.lede: U.S. President Donald Trump's limited trade deal with China removes a major hurdle for Apple and other technology stocks that have already surged this year to record highs.

news_items.headline: Trade deal removes major hurdle for rally in Apple and tech
news_items.lede: U.S. President Donald Trump's limited trade deal with China removes a major hurdle for Apple <AAPL.O> and other technology stocks that have already surged this year to record highs.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, U.S., December 9, 2019. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid

news_items.headline: Google, Apple asked if apps like TikTok must disclose foreign ties
news_items.lede: The chair of a U.S. congressional panel wrote to Alphabet's <GOOGL.O> Google and to Apple <AAPL.O> on Friday to ask what if any disclosures mobile apps are required to make regarding overseas ties, a concern that follows reports of Chinese investment in popular apps such...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Tik Tok logos are seen on smartphones in front of a displayed ByteDance logo in this illustration taken November 27, 2019. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration

news_items.headline: US STOCKS-Wall Street steadies as tech stocks gain on limited trade deal
news_items.lede: * Indexes up: Dow 0.05%, S&P 500 0.08%, Nasdaq 0.30% (Adds comments, updates to early afternoon)
